title: AfCFTA certificate of origin
description: The Africa Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) certificate of origin only applies to goods to be exported to a country that has ratified the AfCFTA agreement.

title: AGOA certificate of origin
description: The African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) is granted if countries have a ‘visa system’ in place that allows tracking the origin and movement of goods effectively, rules of origin are complied with and certain labour and democratic standards are met.

title: Agrochemical business operator license
description: All businesses trading in any chemical or material used for agricultural purposes, must be licensed by the Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA).

title: Agrochemical premises registration
description: In order to trade in any chemical or material used for agricultural purposes, the business owner must first register their premises with the Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA).

title: Agrochemical registration
description: Registration of Agrochemicals is done by RICA.

title: Belgium certificate of origin
description: The Belgium certificate of origin is only required for goods benefiting from duty free treatment for export to Belgium.

title: Business operator license - new EEE
description: Any business operator who wishes to manufacture or import the products and put them on the Rwandan market shall have to be licensed by the Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA).

title: Business operator license - used EEE
Certificate of origin
description: Certificate of origin refers to a document that attests in which country export goods have been obtained, produced, manufactured or processed. It is necessary to profit from trade agreements, such as existing arrangements with EAC, COMESA or EU countries; that grant to certain export products from Rwanda preferable market access.

title: Certificates of origin and quality
description:
A certificate of origin refers to a document that attests in which country export goods have been obtained, produced, manufactured or processed. It is issued by the National Agricultural Export Development Board (NAEB); and is necessary to profit from trade agreements that grant to certain export products from Rwanda preferable market access.
A certificate of quality, also issued by NAEB, specifies the type and grade of the coffee to be exported.

title: China certificate of origin
description: The China certificate of origin is only required for goods benefiting from duty free treatment for export to China.

title: Clearance of animal products at Cyanika border
description: Customs declaration is registered and assessed by a clearing agent appointed by the importer of goods. The clearing agency and/or trader are liable for all information declared on customs declaration.

title: Clearance of animal products at Cyanika border (simplified declaration)
description: Dutiable goods with customs value not exceeding Frw 500,000 may be cleared using simplified declaration. Customs simplified declaration is registered and assessed by Customs officers in order to facilitate small cross border traders declaring small consignments at the borders, bus terminals or post offices.

title: Clearance of animal products at Dar Es Salaam Port - Home consumption
description: Home consumption entry is done in order to pay duties, taxes and fee collected by customs before goods are allowed to be used within the country without any subsequent tax due.

title: Coffee export license
description: A Coffee export license is an official permission to conduct a particular export transaction. For exporting coffee from Rwanda, you will need to obtain a coffee export license from the National Agricultural Export Development Board (NAEB). It is valid for one year and renewable on request.

title: COMESA certificate of origin
description: The Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA) certificate of origin is only required for goods to be exported to a country inside the COMESA region.

title: EAC certificate of origin
description: The East African Community (EAC) certificate of origin is only required for goods to be exported to a country inside the EAC region.

title: EMS certification
description: ISO 14001: 2004 Environmental Management System specifies requirements for an environmental management system to enable an organization to develop and implement a policy and objectives which take into account legal requirements and other requirements to which the organization subscribes, and information about significant environmental aspects.

title: EPR fee paid through a PRO
description: A Producer Responsibility Organisation (PRO) collects the EPR fee and gives recommendation for a producer to obtain the authorization from the regulator to import or manufacture EEE.

title: EPR fee paid through customs
description: EPR fee is collected by the customs on behalf of the regulator authority, along with the taxes and the other fees paid during the clearing process.

title: EU certificate of origin
description: The European Union (EU) certificate of origin is only required for goods benefiting from duty free treatment for export to a country inside the EU region.

title: Export certificate for animal products
description: The export certificate for animal products is issued by Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA); and attests that the exporter observed international laws and regulations, national laws, and those as applied in the exporting country.

title: Export license
description: An export license for medical equipment may be requested by the exporter or the importing country. It is issued by the Rwanda Food and Drugs Authority per consignment.

title: Export license for processed food products
description: An export license for food products may be requested by the exporter or the importing country. It is issued by the Rwanda Food and Drugs Authority .

title: Export operation license
description: An export operation license by the National Agricultural Export Development Board (NAEB) is required for all horticulture products, other than coffee and tea, from Rwanda. It is valid for one year and renewable on request.

title: Export permit
description: The Veterinary Health Certificate for export of Hides and Skins is issued by Rwanda Agriculture and Animal Resources Development Board (RAB) and attests that the exporter observed international laws and regulations, national laws, and those as applied in the exporting country.

title: FSMS certification
description: ISO 22000:2005 Food Safety Management System specifies requirements for a food safety management system where an organization in the food chain needs to demonstrate its ability to control food safety hazards in order to ensure that food is safe at the time of human consumption. The Rwanda Standards Board (RSB) FSMS certification scheme is accredited by the Dutch Accreditation Council (RvA).

title: Full procedure for the import of textile - second hand
description: This procedure sequentially compiles clearance steps to be fulfilled by a registered business owner importing a consignment of textile, which is second hand, of more than Rwf 500,000 of value, for the first time into Rwanda, via Gatuna border.

title: Full procedure for the import of wines and liquors
description: This procedure sequentially compiles the permits and clearance steps to be fulfilled by a registered business owner importing a consignment of wines and liquors of more than Rwf 500,000 of value, for the first time into Rwanda, via Gikondo Inland Customs Office.

title: GSP certificate of origin
description:
The Generalized Systems of Preference (GSP) certificate of origin is only required for a number of goods to be exported to the USA, Australia, Canada, Japan and non-EU countries in Europe. 
Coffee and tea do not qualify for African Growth and Opportunities Act (AGOA) and are therefore exported to the USA under Generalized System of Preferences.

title: HACCP system certification
description: HACCP certification is an international standard defining the requirements for effective control of food safety. The Rwanda Standards Board (RSB) HACCP certification scheme is accredited by the Dutch Accreditation Council (RvA).

title: Health certificate
description: The health certificate is an official document stating that a pet has been examined by a licensed veterinarian and has been found free of communicable diseases or parasites, as of the day the certificate is issued.

title: Health certificate for export to EU - Honey
description: For export of honey to the European Union (EU), traders are required to obtain a health certificate by Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA), fulfilling the EU market requirements as specified by the EU Commission.

title: Import license
description: Prior to importation of processed food products into Rwanda, and for each consignment, the importer must obtain an import license from Rwanda Food and Drugs Authority.

title: Import permit for animal products
description: The importer should obtain an import permit or make certain that existing permits are valid and provide for the entry of the desired material.

title: Import visa
description: A visa in terms of import control is a stamp marked on the applicant's proforma invoice by national authorities of the country to indicate that the applicant's import documents have been verified and medicines detailed on the proforma invoice have been granted permission to enter the country.

title: International veterinary certificate
description: International veterinary certificate is issued by Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA), and attests that the exporter observed international laws and regulations, national laws, and those as applied in the exporting country.

title: Obtain airway bill
description: Airway bill documents that the goods have been transferred from you to the airline. It details nature, quantity, dimensions and the final destination of goods transported as well as the date they have been loaded onto the airplane. This document allows you and the buyer to track the goods while on the way.

title: Obtain import license
description: An import license is a certificated import permit addressed to the importer after complying with the import requirements. It confirms the list of imported products and helps to clear them from customs.

title: Obtain import permit
description: An import permit for cattle is issued by the Rwanda Agriculture Board, per consignment. The consignment must be accompanied by an international health certificate from the country of export.

title: Obtain RAB non objection
description: Prior to submitting application for import permit, cattle importers must obtain a "No objection" statement from the Rwanda Agriculture Board.

title: Phytosanitary certificate
description: A phytosanitary certificate is issued by Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA), attests that the plants or plant products have been inspected and are considered to be free from quarantine pests and conform with the current phytosanitary regulations of the importing country.

title: Plant importation permit
description: The importer should obtain an import permit or make certain that existing permits are valid and provide for the entry of the desired material.

title: Product registration - new EEE
description: Producers of Electronic and electrical equipments must register their products with the Rwanda Inspectorate, Competition and Consumer Protection Authority (RICA).

title: QMS certification
description: ISO 9001:2008 Quality Management Systems is a series of standards, developed and published by the International Organization for Standardization that define, establish and maintain a quality assurance system for manufacturing and service industries.

title: Register premises
description: Premises destined to the manufacture, storing, sale, packaging, distribution and supply of food products must be registered with Rwanda Food and Drugs Authority.

title: Registration of a medical device
description: A company intending to manufacture, import or export a medical device must apply for a registration certificate issued by Rwanda Food and Drugs Authority. A separate application must be submitted for each medical device.

title: Rwanda certificate of origin
description: Rwanda Certificate of Origin is only used to prove that products are originating from Rwanda not for benefiting from preferential tariff treatment.

title: Simplified customs clearance procedure for import at Cyanika border
description: Dutiable goods with customs value not exceeding Frw 500,000 may be cleared using simplified declaration. Customs simplified declaration is registered and assessed by Customs officers in order to facilitate small cross border traders declaring small consignments at the borders, bus terminals or post offices.

description: Dutiable goods with customs value not exceeding Frw 500,000 may be cleared using simplified declaration. title: S-Mark Product certification
description: Certified products are given a Standardisation Mark (S-Mark), a quality mark issued by the Rwanda Standards Board (RSB) and displayed on the product.

title: Tea export license
description: A tea export license is an official permission to conduct a particular export transaction. For exporting tea from Rwanda, you will need to obtain a coffee export license from the National Agricultural Export Development Board (NAEB). It is valid for one year and renewable on request.

title: Test report / Certificate of analysis
description: Test Report or Certificate of Analysis is document issued by Rwanda Standards Board (RSB), attesting that specific goods have undergone specified testing with specified results. Tests on products are carried out against national standards, international standards, specific government regulation and other client specifications.

title: Type approval
description: Type approval or certificate of conformity is a granted by Rwanda Utilities Regulatory Authority (RURA) to a product that meets a minimum set of regulatory, technical and safety requirements.

title: Veterinary health certificate
description: The veterinary health certificate confirms, after inspection by Rwanda Agriculture Board (RAB), that the products are compliant with standards defined in applicable laws concerning production hygiene, microbiological standards for foodstuffs and the health condition of animals.

title: Veterinary health certificate for export
description: The veterinary health certificate for export of dogs and cats is an official document issued by Rwanda Agriculture Board, after the pet has been examined and found free of diseases or parasites.
